page.title: 15LANDSCAPE
page.content: HOPESGATE AND SURROUNDING AREA The lowest point of the area is 140 metres and the highest 384 metres. A dominant feature of the area is Bromlow Callow, a clump of Scots Pine and European Larch trees established in Victorian times. Earlier this century a large area of Bromlow Hill was wooded, this was then greatly reduced and the remaining trees became a striking feature of the landscape, visible for miles.It stands 1,000 feet above sea level and 800 feet above the surrounding countryside in lonely and vulnerable isolation. The A488 road along the Hope Valley,a deep wooded gorge, rises 600 feet in a few miles and is one of Shropshires most noted beauty spots.Hope Church standing at 777 feet.There is considerable geological interest, the Pontesford-Linley fault being evident.
